definition: position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai forced emperor to abdicate and hand over power to him.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凯逼迫皇帝逊位，把政权交给了他。

sentences.english: He abdicated the throne in 1955 to play an active political role as prime minister.
sentences.chinese: 他一九五五年逊位，以首相身分从事积极的政治活动。

sentences.english: More than one hundred old fogies migrated to Qingdao occupied by Genmany after the Qing Dynasty's abdication.
sentences.chinese: 清廷逊位后，一百多名遗老客居德人占据的青岛。

sentences.english: The king signed the instrument of abdication.
sentences.chinese: 国王签署了逊位的文告。

sentences.english: He was castrated, then the emperor abdicated.
sentences.chinese: 他被阉割了，而皇上却逊位了。

definition: to change an emperor's or ruler's reign title (old)
to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
Taishang Huang/Retired Emperor/father of the reigning emperor/fig. puppet master
to succeed to a title/to inherit
